body:
In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Mar 12, 2015, 09:27

E702 comes from pep8. This feature request should be filed there but it will be rejected. pep8 has resisted adding support for `# noqa` on every error code and this is one of them. The PEP-0008 document is rather clear that multiple statements on one line should not be allowed. pep8 the tool reflects that rather well.

In GitLab by @blueyed on Mar 12, 2015, 12:33

Thanks for your clarification.

For reference, the issue in pep8 is: https://github.com/jcrocholl/pep8/issues/211

My use case is a "ipdb" snippet, which is somehow a bit more convenient to have on a single line.  I will try using two lines and/or skipping the linter conditionally.

In GitLab by @ghedsouza on Apr 21, 2016, 10:35

@sigmavirus24: PEP-0008 says

"Compound statements (multiple statements on the same line) are generally discouraged."

"Generally" makes it quite clear this is not intended to be a hard rule.

issue.title: Linter extensions that accept lines/tokens

milestone.description: Next breaking change release of Flake8 with (ideally) as few breaking changes as possible.

repository.name: flake8
repository.description: flake8 is a python tool that glues together pycodestyle, pyflakes, mccabe, and third-party plugins to check the style and quality of some python code.

issue.body:
In GitLab by @twolfson on Nov 19, 2015, 23:28

I am a maintainer of [flake8-quotes][], a `flake8` linter that verifies quotes are being kept consistent in a repo. Due to the nature of our lint, it's much easier for us to work with tokens than an AST. We have been using a workaround which re-reads the file directly.

Unfortunately, we received a report of this not working with `stdin` on Python 3.4 due to `stdin` already being consumed and closed.

https://github.com/zheller/flake8-quotes/issues/12

Instead of putting a hack on top of another hack (i.e. converting the AST back to Python and then convert it into tokens), we were wondering if there was a better solution (e.g. allowing linters to accept lines or tokens directly).

As a side note, we looked around the `pep8` repo a bit and found an integration with `function` that accepts lines directly. However, it's undocumented so we are hesitant to use it.

https://github.com/PyCQA/pep8/blob/4dc42d842274ba27d2724e76eb83ff69e7db226f/pep8.py#L1334-L1342

[flake8-quotes]: https://github.com/zheller/flake8-quotes

issue.body:
In GitLab by @omar-aboumrad on Nov 29, 2015, 03:36

Thank you for flake8, much love.

Is [registering error-codes](http://flake8.readthedocs.org/en/latest/extensions.html) still possible? I'd like to register `M***` for the following [tool](https://github.com/omaraboumrad/mastool)

Also, many of the links seem to be broken on RTD, I presume the reason is you're in the process of migrating to GitLab.

Much appreciated.

issue.title: API for plugins to define which codes it uses

repository.name: flake8
repository.description: flake8 is a python tool that glues together pycodestyle, pyflakes, mccabe, and third-party plugins to check the style and quality of some python code.

issue.body:
In GitLab by @xZise on Jun 1, 2016, 02:24

While working on my two flake8 plugins I noticed that there is no way to define which codes the plugin actually uses. Now if it would be possible to define that it'd allow two features:

1. The ability to inform the user that they ignored a code that isn't supported.
2. Check for collision of codes.

Now as not all plugins will support that at first as this is a new API, flake8 would have to deactivate the first feature and limit the second feature to only those which actually supply the information. But, especially if flake8 tells the user about the plugins that don't support it yet, I would hope that the plugins get updated over time so that at some point this API could be mandatory.

issue.title: Space is forced at 5th position in message

milestone.description: Next breaking change release of Flake8 with (ideally) as few breaking changes as possible.

repository.name: flake8
repository.description: flake8 is a python tool that glues together pycodestyle, pyflakes, mccabe, and third-party plugins to check the style and quality of some python code.

issue.body:
In GitLab by @xZise on Jun 1, 2016, 11:44

As mentioned in #88, it forces a space in the output after the fourth character. So if the message is `BUG>X<-- Space forced there`, the actual output is `:1:2: BUG> <-- Space forced there`. Now you suggested a sample code, but to be honest I'm not exactly sure how to properly trim it down, so here is the class:

```
class Bug141(object):

    version = '1'
    name = 'flake8-bug141'

    def __init__(self, tree, filename):
        pass

    def run(self):
        yield 1, 1, "BUG>X<-- Space forced there", type(self)
```

This also affects how `--ignore` works:
* `--ignore "BUG> "` works, which might be because it is trimming the text, in which case it is not related to the issue above
* `--ignore "BUG> <"` works not
* `--ignore "BUG>_<"` works not too

Apart from that, it should be documented how the error code should be formatted. Some assume that it's always `[A-Z]\d\d\d` while others assume it's always `[A-Z0-9]{4}` while it could be actually anything apart from a space (to separate code from the message).
